item.description: Gutierrez smokes a cigarette in her home in Tempe, Ariz. A devout Catholic, Gutierrez sees the Virgin as an important part of her faith.
Gutierrez smokes a cigarette in her home in Tempe, Ariz. A devout Catholic, Gutierrez considers the Virgin an important part of her faith.

Raquel Gutierrez pulls out an image of the Virgin of Guadalupe in her home Tuesday morning in Tempe, Ariz. Gutierrez, a devout Catholic, has a strong devotion to the Virgin of Guadalupe which she has passed onto her four daughters although only one remains Catholic today. Photo by Deanna Dent
Gutierrez's grandson plays with her dog in the living room. She says she has tried to pass on her religious convictions to her children and grandchildren.

Raquel Gutierrez keeps a Virgin of Guadalupe outside her home Tuesday morning in Tempe, Ariz. Gutierrez, a devout Catholic, has a strong devotion to the Virgin of Guadalupe which she has passed onto her four daughters although only one remains Catholic today. Photo by Deanna Dent

Raquel Gutierrez has a mural of the Virgin of Guadalupe in her kitchen in her home in Tempe, Ariz. Gutierrez, a devout Catholic, has a strong devotion to the Virgin of Guadalupe which she has passed onto her four daughters although only one remains Catholic today. Photo by Deanna Dent

Raquel Gutierrez shares an earring of the Virgin of Guadalupe Tuesday morning in Tempe, Ariz. Gutierrez, a devout Catholic, has a strong devotion to the Virgin of Guadalupe which she has passed onto her four daughters although only one remains Catholic today. Photo by Deanna Dent

Raquel Gutierrez relaxes inside her home Tuesday morning in Tempe, Ariz. Gutierrez, a devout Catholic, has a strong devotion to the Virgin of Guadalupe which she has passed onto her four daughters although only one remains Catholic today. Photo by Deanna Dent

Raquel Gutierrez's Virgin of Guadalupe that was given to her by a Catholic priest in Sells, Arizona. Gutierrez, a devout Catholic, has a strong devotion to the Virgin of Guadalupe which she has passed onto her four daughters although only one remains Catholic today. Photo by Deanna Dent
